description: dark blue robe with thin, white lines patterned at alternating angles; gray inner lining at bottom edge, inner edge of sleeves and inner shoulder area
markings: PR interior, at bottom: Murray Collection label: JAP 6080
medium: Cloth: cotton; mojiri (gauze weave), tate-gasuri (warp ikat), indigo dye
text: This is a child’s pajamas, or nemaki. The cotton was woven in a type of gauze weave (mojiri-ori), which involved twisting the warp threads between the straight weft threads, resulting in a light, breathable fabric ideal for the hot summer months. A small pattern of double lines, arranged in sets of three and created by resist dyeing the warp threads, decorates it. The lighter blue edges of the undyed sections, where a small amount of indigo entered, give these white lines a luminous, almost flamelike quality.
title: Boy’s summer sleepwear (nemaki)
